Good Morning Big Valley Families!
Per Lassen County Public Health Department, there will be no school on Monday, August 24, 2020 due to hazardous air quality in Lassen County.
Lassen County’s Public Health Department has issued a County-Wide Air Quality Alert for Hazardous Air on Saturday, August 22, 2020.
The alert has been issued for all areas of Lassen County. Smoke levels across the county have been classified as: HAZARDOUS.
We will keep you inform when we are able to reopen safely through Facebook and phone calls.

Everyone may begin to experience more serious health effects.

All individuals, especially the elderly, young children, pregnant women, those with lung or heart disease, and anyone with sensitivities to air pollution are to AVOID all outdoor exposure until further notice.

For more information, click on the following link:

https://www.susanvillestuff.com/public-health-department-issues-county-wide-hazardous-air-quality-alert/

Attending school has a huge impact on student success.This year we want to make sure every student misses no more than 9 days of school, or 1 day a month. We need your help.

Some Attendance Tips to Promote Student Learning:

•Make sure your students keep a regular bedtime and establish a morning routine so they are rested and alert when they get to school.
•Turn off all electronics including TVs, phones and tablets at bedtime.
•Make sure clothes and pack backpacks are ready the night before.
•Avoid scheduling vacations or doctor’s appointments when school is in session.

--From Attendance Works
